channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: A Dublin Neighborhood at the Sharp End of Ireland’s Election Issues
item.description: In a northeast neighborhood of the capital city, deprivation and affluence exist side-by-side, and many voters feel frustrated by the status quo.

item.title: Russian central bank takes desperate stand to halt collapsing ruble and fierce inflation
item.description: Worth a fraction of a penny now, the ruble has fallen to lows not seen since March 2022 in the early days of the war against Ukraine.

item.title: Four Opinion Writers Visit Oz and Ask: Who’s Really ‘Wicked’?
item.description: A big-budget holiday film with a strong antifascist message? “Wicked” is not what we expected.

item.title: How Black Friday transformed from chaotic mall mobs to a month of deals—and the surprising reason it’s not all about the internet
item.description: The annual sales event no longer creates the midnight mall crowds or doorbuster mayhem of recent decades. Here's why:

item.title: China Journalist, Dong Yuyu, Is Sentenced to Prison for Espionage
item.description: Dong Yuyu, who has written articles critical of the Communist Party, was arrested in 2022 while having lunch with a Japanese diplomat.

item.title: Sanofi’s chief digital officer says remote work means employees lose the ‘serendipity’ needed to innovate
item.description: "I think we were contrarians,” Sanofi's chief digital officer Emmanuel Frenehard told Fortune. “I think the contrarians are becoming the norm.”

item.title: Lebanon Cease-Fire Appears to Hold Despite Israeli Strike
item.description: Israel said it had targeted militants headed to a rocket facility, but neither Israel nor Hezbollah seemed keen to immediately return to full-scale fi...

item.title: Keira Knightley, who got an agent at 6, says her daughters will focus on academics, not acting: ‘You need those pieces of paper saying you’re smart’
item.description: 'Pirates of the Caribbean' star Kiera Knightley said she wished she had done an Open University course after starring in 'Bend It Like Beckham.'

item.title: Friday Briefing
item.description: The cease-fire between Israel and Hezbollah.

item.description: Inglewood Oil Field owner Sentinel Peak argues in the lawsuit, filed this week, that the law, which was signed in September by Gov. Gavin Newsom, is u...

item.title: Art Collector Who Bought a $6 Million Banana Offers to Buy 100,000 More
item.description: The vendor who sold the banana only received a quarter for the fruit. Now the buyer of the conceptual work has offered his fruit stand a bigger payday...
